result.execSummary:
The defendant Kassidy L. Werner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Repeater, Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Eligible for CIP and SAP - only after 1 year served.
Consecutive to: To sentence currently serving

superMiscConds.notes:
Payment of $360 controlled buy money.
Remits all other fines, costs and DNA surcharge.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today without a valid prescription. 
No contact with known drug users or sellers, except in treatment, and only with prior agent approval.

AODA and follow through.
Mental health evaluation and follow through.
Must take any medications prescribed for mental health or substance abuse.
May only take vivitrol and may not take suboxone or methadone.
Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through recommended by agent.
DNA sample due 10-06-2022.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To sentence currently serving

records.addlTxt:
10:25 AM Defendant Kassidy L. Werner in court, in custody.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Kassidy L. Werner.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. Court appears by ZOOM.
Court calls case.
Court heard on PSI from case 19CF47.
Will use this PSI for this case.
Atty Hansen provides plea form.
ADA heard on agreement.
Atty Hansen agrees.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 3.
Deft enters a plea of no contest.
Non-citizen advisory.
No firearms.
May not vote or serve on jury until civil rights are restored.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Read-ins.
Deft understands.
Elements of offense.
Court reviews prior conviction.
Deft agrees.
Atty Hansen agrees.
Atty Hansen satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty to Count 3.
Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 1 and 2.
Copy of PSI from 19CF47.
Atty Hansen heard on corrections to PSI.
ADA heard on sentencing recommendation.
Atty Hansen heard.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court imposes on Count 3:
3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision, consecutive to sentence currently serving.
No credit for time served.
Eligible for CIP and SAP - only after 1 year of I/C is served.
Conditions of extended supervision:
Remit all fines, costs, and the DNA surcharge.
Payment of $360 controlled buy money.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today, without a valid prescription.
No contact with known drug users or sellers, except in treatment, and only with prior agent approval.
AODA and follow through.
Mental health evaluation and follow through.
Must take any medications prescribed for mental health or substance abuse.
May only take vivitrol and may not take suboxone or methadone.
Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.
DNA sample due 10-06-2022.
Appeal rights.
11:19 AM

2:01 PM Defendant Kassidy L. Werner appeared by video, in custody at Taycheedah.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Kassidy L. Werner.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Court heard on off record discussions.
Atty Hansen heard - believes the case is resolved.
Requests to use PSI from Deft's prior case, 19CF47.
ADA has no objections.
Atty Hansen requests plea and sentencing be scheduled.
Court heard and approves the use of PSI from 19CF47.
Court schedules with parties.
Any new information to be provided to the Court by October 3, 2022.
2:07 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 10:20 am.
Letter from Deft requesting Zoom - APPROVED

4:19 PM Prosecuting attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kassidy L. Werner in court, in custody.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Kassidy L. Werner. 
Atty Hansen confirms prelim today.
ADA calls Detective, Derrick Maye, sworn and examined.
Identifies Deft.
Shown Exhibit #1 - Criminal Comp - offered and received.
Atty Hansen cross-examines.
ADA provides argument.
Atty Hansen reserves argument.
Court finds probable cause and binds Deft over for trial.
Court schedules w/parties.
Atty Hansen requests move to arraignment today.
ADA confirms Information will track complaint.
Atty Hansen satisfied - enters n/g pleas, requests STC.
Court schedules STC w/parties.
4:35 pm
Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:50 pm.

8:35 AM Defendant Kassidy L. Werner appeared by ZOOM, in custody at Taycheedah.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Kassidy L. Werner.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Hansen heard - has reviewed complaint with deft.
Deft understands charges and penalties.
Waives formal readings.
Requests prelim within time limits.
State to writ the Deft back here for the prelim.
Court schedules with parties.
8:38 AM
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

records.addlTxt:
1:44 PM Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kassidy L. Werner appeared by video, in custody.  
Court calls case.
Copy of complaint.
Court reviews charges and max penalties.
Deft understands.
DA heard on bond recommendation.
Deft heard.
Court imposes $2,500 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid RX, no contact with known drug users or sellers. 
Court schedules with parties.
Court allows deft to appear by ZOOM for next hearing if she is transported to prison.
Deft to contact the Public Defender's office today.
1:47 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
